item.title: How to simultaneously write to shared memory with multiple processes
item.description: Most of our modern day computers have more than one processing unit. They are often referred to as cores. For a developer, effectively using multiple cores simultaneously to speed up program execution by parallel processing comes with challenges. One of them is changing the value of a variable in shared memory. In this blog post I introduce one of the two most common methods to overcome this problem by synchronizing access to shared memory: fork and semaphores.
